IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: AUI unites the resources of universities, research organizations and the Federal Government in the planning, construction, and operation of forefront scientific facilities that promote discovery and education while expanding our knowledge of the physical world.
IRS990.MissionDescription: AUI unites the resources of universities, research organizations, and the Federal Government in the planning, construction, and operation of the forefront scientific facilities that promote discovery and education while expanding our knowledge of the physical world.
IRS990.Description: Astronomy and Astrophysics research programs: The organization is constructing two new major facilities that will significantly enhance astronomers' research capabilities and open new scientific frontiers: Atacama Large Millimeter/Submillimeter Array and Expanded Very Large Array which will provide a major step toward a next-generation centimeter-wavelength telescope.

Activity2.Description: Astronomy and Astrophysics research programs: The organization operates a complementary suite of powerful, state of the art radio telescopes for research conducted by the international scientific community. The suite of telescopes include: The Robert C. Byrd Green Bank Telescope, Very Large Array and the Very Large Baseline Array. The organization also provides formal and informal programs in education and public outreach for teachers, students, the general public and the media.

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Schedule A, Part IV, Supplemental Information: Part II, Column (a) line 10- The amount reported of $ 2,540,017 pertained to the allocated indirect cost and management fee revenue for tax year 2005. Beginning in tax year 2006 indirect cost and management fee revenue are included with program income. Part II, Column (c) line 10- the amount reported of $ 4,550,000 pertained to proceeds from the settlement of a lawsuit. Proceeds were received by the organization in tax year 2006.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: AUI adopted the provisions of FASB ASC Topic 740 (formerly FASB Interpretation No. 48 Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes), on October 1, 2009. Under ASC 740, an organization must recognize the tax benefit associated with tax positions taken for tax return purposes when it is more-likely-than-not that the position will be sustained. The implementation of ASC 740 had no impact on AUI's financial statements. AUI's management believes it has no material uncertain tax positions and; accordingly, it will not recognize any liability for unrecognized tax benefits. No interest or penalties were accrued as of October 1, 2009 as a result of the adoption of ASC 740. For the year ended September 30, 2010, there were no interest or penalties recorded or included in the statements of activities. However, tax years ended September 30, 2007-2009 remain open to examination by the taxing jurisdictions to which AUI is subject, and they have not been extended beyond the applicable statute of limitations.
Pension-related changes other than net periodic pension costs: -49930.
Pension-related changes other than net periodic pension costs: -49930.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: NRAO engages students in scientific research through the Summer Student Research Assistantship Program and has conducted the program since 1959. Each summer student conducts research under the supervision of an NRAO staff member at one of three NRAO sites. Supervisors choose the candidates from all applications received and monitor the research conducted over the 10 - 12 week period each summer. Qualifying students are paid a fixed stipend per week based on whether an undergraduate or graduate level. The NRAO Fiscal department processes stipend payments based on supervisor approved pay orders. The AUI Trustee Scholarships are available on a competitive basis to the children of regular full-time and eligible part-time NRAO employees. Three primary scholarships are awarded annually based on a criteria of high school academic achievement, standardized college test scores, and recommendations of the high school. In addition, up to two additional scholarships may be awarded to NRAO employees' children who are African American, Hispanic, or Native American. An independent scholarship committee, reporting to SRP, will select the winners of the AUI Trustee Scholarships.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: First class travel - AUI employees are required to travel economy class unless a special exception is approved prior to travel. Tax indemnification and gross-up payments - AUI provided tax gross-up payments pertaining to supplemental payments for two employee's supplemental retirement contributions that were limited by restrictions imposed by OBRA 1993. The procedure followed was to calculate the gross-up amount to ensure these two employees received an after tax payment equal to the amount which would have been contributed on their behalf if not for the ABRA restriction. Housing allowance - AUI follows established policy pertaining to temporary housing allowances provided to employees who have accepted a change of duty station if the employee has rented or purchased living quarters and is making a good faith effort to sell his/her primary residence. Health or social club dues - AUI paid the annual dues for membership to an academically-oriented social club, which is used for business purposes. Travel for companions- The AUI Board of Trustees normally holds one Board meeting a year that is designated as a special meeting to which spouses (or guests) of trustees are invited to attend.

AUI established a 457(b) Supplemental Retirement Plan for a select group of management and highly compensated employees. During Fiscal Year ended September 30, 2010, one employee participated in the plan.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Associated Universities, Inc. has its external audit firm review the draft Form 990 prior to submitting it to the AUI Audit Committee for review. On behalf of the AUI Board of Trustees, the Audit Committee reviews the Form 990 and reports the findings of their review to the full Board. The final draft of the Form 990 is made available to the AUI Board of Trustees prior to submission to the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Associated Universities, Inc. has a conflict of interest policy which addresses financial disclosure to ensure that AUI Trustees, Officers, and employees do not have significant financial interests that would reasonably appear to directly and significantly affect their work with AUI or one of its Research Centers. AUI Trustees, Officers, and employees must disclose their significant financial interests, as well as their spouses or dependent children, when that interest would reasonably appear to directly or significantly affect their work. These disclosures are to be updated annually or as new reportable financial interests are obtained. AUI Trustees, Officers, and key employees are reminded to review and update, if necessary, their financial disclosures each year.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation levels involving the hiring, promotion, and salary adjustments for the AUI President, Officers, and Research Center Directors are approved by AUI's Board of Trustees based on recommendations from the AUI President and AUI Compensation Subcommittee. In all cases, the salary recommendations are based on annual performance evaluations of the employee by their supervisor. The AUI President and AUI Compensation Subcommittee review third-party comparability data on salaries and benefits provided by similar other nonprofit scientific research organizations. In the case of the AUI President (CEO), the Chair of the AUI Board of Trustees, in consultation with the AUI Executive Committee and AUI Compensation Subcommittee, annually reviews the President's written self-evaluation and makes a recommendation for a salary adjustment to the Board for approval. In the case of the Officers and Research Center Directors, the AUI President annually reviews the performance of each Officer and Research Center Director, which is based on the individual's self-evaluation. Based on the performance appraisal, the AUI President, in consultation with the AUI Compensation Subcommittee, makes a recommendation for salary adjustments to the AUI Board of Trustees. After reviewing the recommendations, the AUI Board of Trustees approves salary adjustments for the AUI President, Officers, and Research Center Directors, which are recorded in the Minutes. In addition, after reviewing all compensation decisions, the AUI Board of Trustees determines that the salaries and benefits to be received by the persons currently holding these positions are reasonable and do not constitute excessive benefit transactions as defined by Section 4958 of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC).

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Associated Universities, Inc. responds to written requests for these documents on a case-by-case basis.
There have been no changes during the year in the process for oversight of the audit of the financial statements.
